intro: Cacalia multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered cacalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color, and they bloom in late spring to early summer. Cacalia multiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
